data.title: Alliant Energy Foundation
data.meta_description: Throughout our company, we are committed to providing exceptional service to our customers and building strong communities. We look for opportunities and partnerships that foster intentional inclusion of diverse perspectives leading to more equitable outcomes and greater impacts for the communities we serve.
data.text:
Since 1998, the Alliant Energy Foundation has invested more than $73 million in local community organizations and initiatives. Fueled by the passion of our employees and retirees, the company and Foundation work together to improve the quality of life in communities where Alliant Energy has a presence. We're building partnerships rooted in diverse perspectives that bring more equitable outcomes and greater impact.

Each year, the Foundation supports projects that help families thrive, encourage communities to innovate, and protect the natural beauty of Iowa and Wisconsin.

The Alliant Energy Foundation is an independent, nonprofit philanthropic organization. The Foundation is funded solely by shareowner dollars from Alliant Energy Corporation.

Learn more about our community giving programs.

We focus our giving on strategic areas that align with our values and initiatives in communities served by Alliant Energy.

Through our support of Hunger and Housing, we ensure families don’t have to choose between a roof over their head or a meal on the table.

By focusing on Workforce Readiness, we prepare children and adults with the fundamental skills they need to grow into successful careers.

Protecting, restoring, and creating access to natural habitats are part of our Environmental Stewardship funding so that everyone can fall in love with Iowa and Wisconsin.

Our support of Community Safety & Engagement strengthens our communities by improving safety for our first responders and giving neighbors a chance to engage with one another.

Learn more about the specific types of projects we fund in each area and what we don’t fund.

The Alliant Energy Foundation board of directors establishes program guidelines reflective of our values and mission. They guide our giving strategy.

Alliant Energy Foundation board of directors

Diane Cooke – Vice President – Human Resources

Aimee Davis – Vice President – Communications and Marketing

David de Leon – Senior Vice President – President, Wisconsin Power and Light

Robert Durian – Executive Vice President – Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer

Terry Kouba – Senior Vice President – President, Interstate Power and Light
